item.title: For asylum seekers, reaching the UK puts them in a ferocious political storm
item.description: Trying to get to the UK is a treacherous journey for refugees. Even if they make it, growing protests and increasingly hard-line policies are waiting for them.

item.title: Benjamin Netanyahu's Gaza plan ignores criticism from inside and outside Israel
item.description: The debate in the Israeli media over Benjamin Netanyahu's plans to occupy Gaza have barely mentioned the fate of the two million people who live there.

item.title: US sanctions powerful Cambodian tycoon over alleged human rights abuses in scam operations
item.description: The United States announces sanctions on one of Cambodia's wealthiest and most powerful tycoons over alleged human rights abuses related to the treatment of trafficking victims forced to work in online scam centres.

item.title: Fertility Society rocked by allegations of $3m fraud as D-day looms on regulator's future
item.description: Shocking allegations of suspected embezzlement at the fertility industry's peak body have been revealed just days before Australia's health ministers meet to decide the future of how the organisation self-regulates the IVF sector.

item.title: Whales and dolphins at play
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Indian actor Navya Nair fined for bringing jasmine flower garland into Australia
item.description: The incident involving Navya Nair highlights a common concern facing many visitors to Australia — what can be brought in without the risk of breaching strict biosecurity laws?

item.title: Are Myanmar's upcoming elections a 'peace-building process' or a 'trap'?
item.description: Nearly five years ago, Myanmar's military seized power, plunging the country into a bloody civil war that left the junta internationally isolated. Now, with no end to the conflict in sight, Myanmar is going to the polls again.

item.title: GWS Giants conquer Geelong in thriller, Brisbane held to draw with North Melbourne in Hobart
item.description: Chris Fagan and Alastair Clarkson share different views on extra time after their draw, as Chris Scott defends at Cats veteran over a costly miss.

item.title: Pakistan publicly vows revenge for India's air strikes, but signals willingness to de-escalate
item.description: As the world waits with bated breath to see what will happen next between India and Pakistan, there are signs the conflict between the two nuclear-armed states may have reached a plateau.

item.title: FOI emails raise new questions about government's role in scientific report into Murujuga rock art
item.description: In May, the WA government released a report from an ongoing study into the impacts of industrial air emissions on ancient rock carvings, but new emails obtained by FOI have raised questions about the government's role in the scientific report.

item.title: Brisbane Lions beat Gold Coast Suns in QClash as Hawthorn smash Richmond and Sydney defeats GWS
item.description: The Brisbane Lions are top of the AFL ladder again after a 17-point win over Gold Coast in the QClash at the Gabba.

item.title: FOI emails raise new questions about government's role in scientific report into Murujuga rock art
item.description: In May, the WA government released a report from an ongoing study into the impacts of industrial air emissions on ancient rock carvings, but new emails obtained by FOI have raised questions about the government's role in the scientific report.

item.title: Arsonists set fire to home of Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro, police say
item.description: Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro and his family are evacuated from their home in the middle of the night after an arsonist set fire to the residence, according to police.

item.title: Former Roebuck Bay Hotel worker tells court of repeated indecent assaults
item.description: A former security guard at Broome's Roebuck Bay Hotel says she was repeatedly indecently assaulted by the venue's former manager while on shift.

item.title: Murray Watt stamps final approval of Woodside's North West Shelf extension to 2070
item.description: Australia's biggest gas project, Woodside's North West Shelf, has received final approval to extend operations through until 2070.

item.title: Exhibition of ceramic work by Purple House dialysis patients opens in Alice Springs
item.description: Between treatments, Purple House patients have been creating colourful works of ceramic art. The results are now on display in Alice Springs.

item.title: Alice Springs suicide prevention walk bolstered by funding announcements
item.description: A study will work with Indigenous researchers who will map cultural assets and integrate traditional healing to improve outcomes in remote centres.

item.title: How Hawthorn and Gold Coast proceed to the AFL preliminary finals
item.description: Hawthorn and Gold Coast go into their cut-throat semifinals with reasons for some confidence against the Crows and Lions. Cody Atkinson and Sean Lawson look into the factors driving both teams' September runs.

item.title: Donald Trump is leading an overt attack on the institutions underpinning the US economy
item.description: Just as happened with the Supreme Court in the legal sphere, the United States president has the opportunity to shape — and possibly distort — America's economic institutions.

item.title: Murder trial begins for mother of children found in suitcases in New Zealand storage unit
item.description: The children's remains were found when the unclaimed suitcases were sold at auction by the facility.

item.title: Littleproud leadership 'irreparably damaged' as Joyce vows to back McCormack
item.description: Nationals MP Barnaby Joyce has indicated privately to colleagues that he would back former rival Michael McCormack if he sought the troubled minority party's top job.

item.title: Lockyer Valley Correctional Centre, Queensland's largest prison, takes first inmates
item.description: The Lockyer Valley Correctional Centre has opened for business and its first inmates are in their cells.

item.title: Trial of three accused of murder of David Jenkins hears from alleged subject of dispute Larissa Jean Murfet
item.description: A Tasmanian woman who was allegedly the subject of a dispute that left one man dead and another accused of his murder says she has almost no memory of the evening because she had used "a lot of drugs".

item.title: Perth man found guilty of murdering Helen Marsuk after body found in South Fremantle harbour
item.description: A man accused of murdering a woman he invited to his house to have sex with him in exchange for drugs is found guilty.

item.title: What I learnt from three months of slashing my screen time
item.description: For sometimes up to 12 hours a day, I was falling prey to rage bait and the comparison trap. I wondered what it would be like to live without that noise.

item.title: Murdochs resolve succession saga but family's hold on empire is vulnerable
item.description: Rupert Murdoch's family has always been close. But if you really want to trace the extent of filial and sibling affection, you need to follow the money.

item.title: Melbourne seat of Calwell highlights Labor woes as Gaza pain galvanises Muslim voters
item.description: Dissatisfaction with the Albanese government's stance on Israel-Palestine among many Arab and Muslim voters threatens to unseat Labor MPs, in some places for the first time.

item.title: NRL finals: Melbourne Storm defeat Canterbury Bulldogs 26-18, Stephen Crichton injured
item.description: Melbourne is through to another NRL preliminary final after a tough 26-18 win over Canterbury, while the Bulldogs are sweating on the fitness of captain Stephen Crichton.

item.title: What happens to your data when you trade or recycle your device?
item.description: A cybercrime expert says trading or recycling electronics may not completely erase personal data and users should adopt a "risk-adjusted strategy" when disposing of devices.

item.title: Push for seniors' dental scheme grows ahead of federal election
item.description: Imagine living in aged care and not having your teeth or dentures properly cleaned and checked each day. That's a risk faced by elderly Australians, prompting calls for the next federal government to boost oral health training and services.

item.title: NATO announces operation 'Eastern Sentry' in response to Russian drone incursion in Poland
item.description: NATO announces plans to beef up the defence of Europe's eastern flank two days after Poland shot down Russian drones that had violated its airspace.

item.title: Australia's growing cohort of tenants fear they will rent forever
item.description: Home ownership rates in Australia have been falling for decades, and with rental vacancies at record lows and prices at historic highs, many fear their dream of owning a home may be out of reach. Some experts say rental caps could help.

item.title: Construction workers are at higher risk of suicide. Here's how to look out for them
item.description: Construction workers are nearly twice as likely to take their own lives as other employed Australian men of the same age. Understanding the risks can help us better support those we know in the industry.

item.title: What were assassinated right-wing influencer Charlie Kirk's views?
item.description: Assassinated right-wing activist Charlie Kirk was an icon for young conservatives in the USA and Australia — so what were some of his views that so enraged some people, but energised others?

item.title: 'Clone' websites catch out Australian customers as online shopping scams become 'alarmingly' common
item.description: Online shopping scams are now one of the most frequently reported scam types and experts say they are alarmingly common, impersonating well-known brands and being promoted in search engine advertisements.

item.title: Islamophobia has been 'persistent' and 'ignored', envoy says — as it happened
item.description: A long-awaited report into Islamophobia in Australia has been handed down, with the special envoy finding it has been "persistent" and "ignored".

item.title: Muslim groups call for rethink of approach to terrorism ahead of Islamophobia report
item.description: Community leaders say the government must consider social and legal reforms to address a spike in Islamophobic incidents.

item.title: Matildas to face England Lionesses in October international window
item.description: The Matildas have announced an international friendly against England this October, the first time they will face the European champions since the semifinal of the 2023 FIFA Women's World Cup.

item.title: Pacific leaders reaffirm support for Taiwan's right to attend regional forum
item.description: Despite pressure from Beijing, Pacific leaders have backed Taiwan's right to attend the Pacific Islands Forum.

item.title: Neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell ordered to complete community service for intimidating police officer
item.description: Neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell has been ordered to serve 200 hours of community service after being found guilty of intimidating a police officer.

item.title: PM François Bayrou has lost a confidence vote and France's government has collapsed. What now?
item.description: A series of challenges sees François Bayrou, who Emmanuel Macron backed to be PM, ousted from office, plunging the country in a deepening political crisis.

item.title: Cost of living, housing among key concerns in SA marginal seat of Boothby
item.description: At this year’s federal election, the South Australian seat of Boothby is one of the state’s two marginal seats. As part of the ABC’s “Your Say” campaign, we spoke to residents in the electorate about their biggest concerns.

item.title: ASX higher on US rate cut expectations, but markets underestimating inflation risk — as it happened
item.description: The ASX rises, as do Virgin shares, as the airline reveals the exit pay of its former CEO. Westpac's economics team, led by former RBA assistant governor Luci Ellis, say they think markets are underpricing the risk of a renewed inflation breakout in the US.

item.title: What if your child is being bullied, but the school won't act?
item.description: There can be a range of clues parents can pick up on when their child is being bullied. Here's how to approach it with your child, and how to advocate for them at school.

item.title: Update your ABC News homepage for more local stories
item.description: We've got an ABC News homepage for you. Adjust your settings for the right mix of local and national news.

item.title: Nauru's unorthodox money-making schemes are a 'riches to rags to riches' story
item.description: Experts say Nauru's new deal with Australia to take non-citizens is the latest episode in an unconventional economic story — one featuring phenomenal growth, a mining bust, and a failed musical about a Renaissance genius.

item.title: Evidence points to remains found in Vietnam cave being South-East Asia's earliest known homicide victim
item.description: It was on a sweltering morning in 2018 in a cave in northern Vietnam when Chris Stimpson and his team uncovered what may be the oldest cold case murder in South-East Asia.

item.title: Independent accreditation system for fertility sector to be established as all recommendations of IVF review accepted
item.description: Federal Health Minister Mark Butler has announced he has accepted all recommendations of a rapid review into the IVF sector at a meeting with state and territory health ministers in Perth.

item.title: Regulator with oversight of gas leak 'scandal' had paid role with industry lobbyist
item.description: The man in charge of the Northern Territory government's handling of a major methane leak at a Santos gas plant was working with a lobbyist for the project's co-owner.

item.title: New Zealand fugitive Tom Phillips killed in shootout with police after four years on the run
item.description: Tom Phillips is killed during a shootout with police during a burglary in New Zealand's Waikato region, his sister says.

item.title: Terry Irving awarded $130,000 for malicious prosecution that led to wrongful imprisonment over 1993 Cairns robbery
item.description: Terry Irving was initially charged as an accessory for loaning his car to the man responsible for robbing a bank in 1993. But while he was in custody, he was charged with the robbery itself.

item.title: Jaime Martín on bringing the Melbourne Symphony Orchestra on tour to the UK and Europe
item.description: Jaime Martín on how he fell in love with Melbourne, taking the Melbourne Symphony Orchestra home to Santander and championing Australian composers on world stages.

item.title: Pacific Islands Forum sees Australia-China push for regional influence get 'comical'
item.description: Anthony Albanese begins a long Pacific tour this week ahead of the Pacific Islands Forum meeting in Solomon Islands, as the battle for influence between China and Australia continues to create headlines.

item.title: Elderly Porepunkah woman left without in-home care as Freeman manhunt continues
item.description: Elderly residents of Porepunkah have had their home nurse visits cancelled as alleged police killer Dezi Freeman remains at large.

item.title: Prince Harry arrives in Kyiv to meet with wounded Ukrainian war veterans
item.description: Prince Harry has travelled by train to Ukraine, for the second time since Russia invaded in early 2022.

item.title: South Korean workers return home after ICE raids at US Hyundai factory
item.description: The workers arrived home to emotional scenes as many consider never returning to the US following the raids which have caused serious tension between the longstanding allies.

item.title: North West Shelf extension comes at critical juncture in Australia's climate conversation
item.description: Seven years after it was first mooted, the extension of Australia's biggest gas project could not have landed at a more critical juncture for the nation's climate credentials.

item.title: Is the pink soap scum in my bathroom mould, or something else?
item.description: Have you ever noticed a pink or orange-coloured substance in the tile grout or around taps in your bathroom? In most cases, it's one of two things.

item.title: Limestone Coast is a food bowl and forestry powerhouse, but its water supply is under threat
item.description: South Australia's Limestone Coast is home to lush terrain in Australia's driest state, but its groundwater supplies are slowly in decline.

item.title: Mobile coverage is an election issue in regional areas. What's been promised?
item.description: For many regional and remote Australians, reliable mobile coverage can be life-saving. They are desperate for both sides of politics to take meaningful action towards eliminating black spots.

item.title: Call for button battery redesign after new study reveals horrific injuries and fatalities
item.description: A new study reveals the horrific injuries suffered after swallowing or inserting button batteries but manufacturers aren't prioritising their redesign.

item.title: Youth leaders in Nepal discuss interim leadership options with the army as two frontrunners emerge
item.description: After days of deadly violence, protest organisers have met with Nepal's army to try to plot a path forward for the country, which has a deep distrust of democratic politics.

item.title: Female farmers determined to defy NSW dairy industry exodus
item.description: As repeated natural disasters and stagnating milk prices see dairy farmers walk away from the industry, these women are looking at smaller changes to help shore up their future.

item.title: Growing group of Labor MPs urge 2035 emissions target above Climate Authority's floor
item.description: A growing cross-factional group within Labor is privately urging for Australia's next major climate target to respect the advice of the Climate Change Authority, which will hand its opinion on a 2035 target to government any day.

item.title: Disagreement over way forward for Australian National University after Genevieve Bell resigns as vice-chancellor
item.description: The resignation of Australian National University vice-chancellor Genevieve Bell has sparked furious debate over whether it constitutes enough of a "reset" for the institution after months of controversy.

item.title: Netanyahu and Putin escalate their wars as Trump looks on
item.description: In the Middle East and in Europe, political leaders are making their own arrangements in the absence of US leadership.

item.title: Haven't started on your tax return and feeling overwhelmed?
item.description: Despite being something most of us tackle every year, lodging a tax return can easily end up at the bottom of your to-do list.

item.title: Indian Australians respond to being targets of abuse after negative political attention
item.description: Nearly two weeks after the "March for Australia" rallies, the Indian Australian community continues to grapple with the political targeting of the diaspora.

item.title: France could hold snap elections again amid deadlock and calls for Emmanuel Macron's resignation
item.description: France is stuck in a cycle of political chaos, with no clear end in sight. It has sparked calls for President Emmanuel Macron's resignation and has become so dire that another round of snap legislative elections is considered possible.

item.title: Next-generation voters call for better engagement ahead of federal election
item.description: Young people in Albury say issues that directly affect them and their communities are not being addressed by major parties for the 2025 election campaign.

item.title: Former minister Greg Hunt works for Brethren company whose owners made millions on COVID contracts
item.description: The Sydney-based church has been described by former members and Prime Minister Anthony Albanese as a "cult".

item.title: Islamophobia envoy calls for religious discrimination laws, review of approach to counter-terrorism
item.description: In a landmark report, newly-appointed Aftab Malik also calls for counter-terrorism laws and approaches to be reviewed, and for national inquiries into Islamophobia and anti-Palestinian racism.

item.title: Homebuyers turn to shared ownership in expensive Wollongong market
item.description: Friends Gem and Renata have saved money buying a home together with their respective families in Wollongong, and say the pay-off goes much further.

item.title: The Nampijinpa Price saga doesn't bode well for the future of the Liberal party
item.description: The fracas over Jacinta Nampijinpa Price shows the Liberal party is a seething mass of frustrated ambition, resentment, tribalism and deep ideological division.

item.title: In their Melbourne Fringe Show, First Trimester, performer Krishna Istha is seeking a sperm donor
item.description: Krishna Istha has made a habit of turning to performance to solve a problem. So when they needed help to find a sperm donor, the solution was obvious.

item.title: Court hears details of Hakyung Lee's 'descent into madness' before children's deaths
item.description: Hakyung Lee is accused of murdering her children, eight-year-old Yuna Jo and six-year-old Minu Jo, and leaving their remains in suitcases at a storage facility in Auckland.

item.title: An Ozzy Osbourne tribute, a Mayhem Ball and a Mariah Carey medley delight fans at the 2025 MTV VMAs
item.description: Ariana Grande and Lady Gaga took home the biggest awards at this year's MTV VMAs with several nineties stars honoured for their musical legacy.

item.title: Community farewells Dapto Dogs after 90 years of greyhound racing
item.description: One of the most famed tracks in Australian greyhound racing, known as the Dapto Dogs, has held its final race meet after almost 90 years.

item.title: Right-wing activist and Trump ally Charlie Kirk shot dead at Utah university
item.description: Donald Trump confirms Charlie Kirk has been shot dead in front of a crowd of horrified students, with the US president describing the conservative activist as a "tremendous person" and a "very good friend".

item.title: The US election is about style more than substance. It's why Kamala Harris needs to nail her DNC speech in about eight seconds
item.description: When the Democrat presidential candidate Kamala Harris delivers her speech to the Democratic National Convention today, style will be almost everything.

item.title: Artists and users boycotting Spotify over AI use and CEO's military tech
item.description: A growing number of artists and users are leaving Spotify. What's changed with the streaming giant? And what comes next?

item.title: Australia on alert to shot-hole borer threat as WA pivots to tree canopy rehabilitation
item.description: It's barely the size of a sesame seed, but the shot-hole borer has quickly devastated Western Australia's tree canopy. Experts are warning other states and territories to take action now to avoid a similar fate.

item.title: Quote Quiz: Who said it, Lachlan Murdoch or Succession's Kendall Roy?
item.description: As Lachlan Murdoch's ascension to the head of the family business is cemented, can you tell his quotes apart from Succession's self-proclaimed "eldest boy", Kendall Roy?

item.title: Clive Palmer's human rights complaint referred to Supreme Court amid ongoing legal battles
item.description: Mr Palmer is facing two counts of fraud and dishonestly using his position as a company director to funnel millions into his party's 2013 election campaign, and in a separate matter, his company is charged with breaching company takeover laws in 2012.

item.title: Energy projects in South West WA threaten votes for major federal parties
item.description: Australia's two major parties have tied their federal election fates to controversial energy projects in WA's South West where the issues have polarised voters.

item.title: Voters tell ABC's Your Say they want politicians with a vision, not bickering
item.description: Voters tell ABC's Your Say campaign they want courage and vision from politicians, not bickering.

item.title: Qatar's prime minister accuses Israel of ignoring Gaza hostages in attack on Hamas in Doha
item.description: The Qatari prime minister tells the United Nations Security Council that Israel went "beyond any borders" with the strike and says Benjamin Netanyahu is to blame for killing "any hope for those hostages".

item.title: Graduates in 'debt vortex' as HECS front and centre for first time in an election
item.description: New research shows a sharp rise in HECS debts, despite graduate earning power declining, as student loans become a potent election issue for the first time.

item.title: British YouTube creator Yung Filly to travel home to UK on bail for sexual assault charges
item.description: British YouTube content creator Yung Filly, who's facing trial in Perth on sex assault charges, is granted permission to travel home to the UK for the first time since he was arrested.

item.title: Blood moon delights stargazers as total lunar eclipse seen from Australia
item.description: Stargazers around the world are dazzled by the sight of a "blood moon" — or total lunar eclipse — with the spectacular sight even visible from Australia.

item.title: Indonesia floods death toll rises as Australian woman thanks her dogs for saving her life
item.description: Authorities are still cleaning up following the disaster, which hit two islands in the archipelago amid warnings more rain could fall in affected areas in coming days.

item.title: Housing advocates seek federal funding election promise for co-op model
item.description: Advocates admit co-operative housing models are not for everyone but say for the right residents, they offer more security and affordable pricing than traditional rentals.

item.title: Australians watched the moment of Charlie Kirk's assassination on social media with no warning
item.description: Young Australians say they are seeing graphic video of US commentator Charlie Kirk being shot dead pop up in their social media algorithms without warning.

item.title: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price accused of working against NT electorate on migration
item.description: Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price has spoken repeatedly of the "damaging impacts of mass migration" – but the Northern Territory wants to attract thousands more migrants.

item.title: Conflict on campus between staff and management as thousands are sacked and courses cut
item.description: With the university sector in crisis, thousands face losing their jobs as unions blame poor management and students say they've lost hope.

item.title: Hawthorn ends Adelaide's season with rollicking semifinal win, setting up epic Geelong prelim final date
item.description: Hawthorn will face Geelong in a preliminary final after knocking minor premier Adelaide out with a 34-point semifinal victory. Follow live.

item.title: 'Unconscionable' for Ireland to participate in Eurovision 2026 if Israel takes part, says broadcaster
item.description: Irish national broadcaster RTE has said Ireland will not participate in Eurovision 2026 if Israel does, citing the ongoing and appalling loss of lives in Gaza.

item.title: Sushila Karki sworn in as Nepal's new prime minister after Gen Z protests prompt political change
item.description: Sushila Karki garnered widespread support from many young Nepalese people who took to the streets in anger over government corruption.

item.title: Nepal's gen Z protesters are continuing the fight for their future even after picking a new prime minister
item.description: A calm has fallen on Nepal's streets after days of violence and chaos. But leaders of the gen Z protest movement say the work's not done.

item.title: Reserve Bank restructure closer to reality after Treasurer Jim Chalmers offers olive branch to Angus Taylor
item.description: The Reserve Bank of Australia is a step closer to its biggest restructure in three decades after the treasurer offers an assurance to his Coalition counterpart.

item.title: Melbourne names Geelong assistant Steven King as new senior coach as Nathan Buckley is overlooked
item.description: Melbourne surprises the AFL world by naming Geelong assistant Steven King as its new senior coach despite persistent links with Nathan Buckley.

item.title: Australian airlines fare poorly in global ranking of frequent flyer programs
item.description: Millions of Australians are signed up to airline loyalty schemes, but a new global ranking finds travellers are getting poorer value than from overseas carriers.

item.title: Scientists hope planting Palau's 'super corals' will save reefs from climate change
item.description: Palau's corals have emerged unscathed from the world's devastating marine heatwaves. Researchers are breeding and planting them to save reefs from disappearing.

item.title: Australians tell ABC's Your Say they are struggling more than ever with housing costs
item.description: Voters tell ABC's Your Say campaign they are struggling more than ever with housing costs.

item.title: How Jamal Fogarty learned to be the hero Canberra needed for its premiership charge
item.description: Jamal Fogarty has spent a rugby league lifetime waiting to play on a team like the Raiders. Now with the NRL finals approaching, he's ready for his close-up.

item.title: Health, climate and community sport: What older voters in the Tasmanian seat of Bass are talking about this election
item.description: The federal seat of Bass is held by a margin of just 1.4 per cent. For these older voters who live in the electorate, health, climate and community sport are the issues that will decide their vote.

item.title: China announces new nature reserve on contested Scarborough Shoal
item.description: China says its newly announced reserve is about preserving coral, but the Philippines says it is another step towards Bejing tightening its claim on a contested, strategic area of the South China Sea.

item.title: 'Low levels of satisfaction' with healthcare in Canberra for endometriosis, menopause, identified in Women's Health Matters survey
item.description: A survey of women in Canberra about the state of their wellbeing and health reveals large gaps in access and affordability, as well as the staggering statistic that almost half of respondents felt doctors weren't taking them seriously.

item.title: Armani drama beyond the grave as will instructs heirs to sell or list on stock market
item.description: Giorgio Armani's will has surprised fashion watchers as it contains instructions to gradually sell off his company to a luxury brand or seek a listing on the stock market, in seeming contrast to his fiercely independent stance throughout his career.

item.title: Government urged to do more to address 2,500 hospital patients waiting for aged care beds
item.description: States and territories will use a health ministers' meeting today to call on the federal government to do more to address what they say is a critical aged care crisis affecting hospitals around the nation.

item.title: Netball Australia, players strike revenue-sharing deal in collective player agreement
item.description: Netball Australia and the players' association strike a landmark revenue-sharing deal as part of a three-year collective player agreement.

item.title: Elon Musk could receive a $US1 trillion payment package from Tesla. Here's what to know
item.description: Tesla's board has proposed a $US1 trillion ($1.52 trillion) compensation plan for CEO Elon Musk in what would be the largest corporate pay package in history.

item.title: Tyler Robinson, 22, in custody after manhunt for conservative activist Charlie Kirk's killer
item.description: US authorities arrest a man who they say confessed or "implied" to a family friend that he killed right-wing activist Charlie Kirk.

item.title: Toni Jordan spent her childhood at the greyhound track, inspiring her new novel Tenderfoot
item.description: The acclaimed author's father was a greyhound trainer and her mother ran a TAB. Her unconventional childhood inspired her eighth book, Tenderfoot.

item.title: Tiwi Islanders eager to have their say as remote voting for the federal election begins
item.description: Voters in the small remote community of Pirlangimpi on the Tiwi Islands, north of Darwin, have become some of the first to cast their votes for the federal election.

item.title: 'Bubble curtain' ready to protect cuttlefish as algal bloom persists in SA
item.description: A "bubble curtain" is set for activation as part of South Australia's fight against the ongoing algal bloom, as the state government defends its handling of health advice.

item.title: Donald Trump and his 'good man' Anthony Albanese share some common ground
item.description: The MAGA president's grip on the Republican party is near total while Albanese holds a sway over his left-leaning caucus like few of his Labor predecessors.

item.title: Have Your Say: What was the issue, policy or event that decided your vote?
item.description: After a five-week campaign, the results are in with Labor returned to government. Is there a policy or issue that swayed your vote? Have Your Say.

item.title: Australian basketballer Tiana Mangakahia dies of cancer aged 30
item.description: The family of Australian basketballer Tiana Mangakahia has paid tribute to the former Opals and WNBL player, describing her as a "shining light" after her death from cancer at the age of 30.

item.title: Journey Home, David Gulpilil shows the film icon's remote homeland 'for the first time'
item.description: Legendary Yolŋu actor David Gulpilil held an ambition throughout his career to share a part of himself and his culture that the world had never seen before. A new documentary does exactly that.
